intro: Podocarpus formosensis var. koshuensis, commonly known as the Koshu pine, is a rare and endemic species native to Taiwan. It is a coniferous evergreen tree characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and distinctive cone structures. The plant belongs to the family Podocarpaceae and is notable for its slow growth and ornamental value. It thrives in cool, moist climates and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
